summary: This document is an email chain from February 7, 2020, regarding a Grand Jury subpoena for American Airlines travel records related to Ghislaine Maxwell. An American Airlines employee, Donna Williams, attaches the requested records, which include passenger reservation records, ticket copies, and usage information.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The email chain is about providing American Airlines travel records in response to a Grand Jury subpoena for records related to her.

persons.name: Donna Williams

connections.description: Donna Williams, as an American Airlines security analyst, is providing travel records related to Ghislaine Maxwell in response to a legal subpoena.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued
events.description: A Grand Jury subpoena was issued, requesting American Airlines travel records related to Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Travel Records Provided
events.description: American Airlines employee Donna Williams sends an email with attached travel records (passenger reservations, ticket copies, usage info) for Ghislaine Maxwell in response to the Grand Jury subpoena.

keyFacts: A Grand Jury subpoena was issued for American Airlines travel records related to Ghislaine Maxwell.
American Airlines employee Donna Williams provided the records, which included passenger reservation records, ticket copies, and ticket usage information.
The email chain shows the records were sent on February 7, 2020, in response to a subpoena dated February 5, 2020.
The document indicates ongoing investigative efforts into Ghislaine Maxwell's travel activities as part of the Epstein case.
